image.altText: An Indigenous AFL player lifts his shirt and points to the colour of his skin in response to racial vilification by the crowd.

props.synopsis: Lawyers say former Indigenous footballer Nicky Winmar could spearhead a class action racism lawsuit against the AFL.

title.children: Former player Nicky Winmar joins class action against AFL, lawyers say

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Police say the driver of the car initially left the scene at Wonthaggi in regional Victoria, but returned and was charged with culpable driving.

title.children: Woman walking dog allegedly killed by car driving on wrong side of road

image.altText: A photo of Emmanuel College in Warrnambool, with several students sitting on the lawn

props.synopsis: A former teacher takes a Victorian Catholic school to the Fair Work Commission, alleging she was fired after raising concerns about bullying within staff.

title.children: Private school teacher allegedly sacked after flagging staff bullying

image.altText: Construction work is seen on a beach.

props.synopsis: Residents in Melbourne's south-east and a state MP have raised concerns over potentially unauthorised construction along a section of Frankston Beach.

title.children: Concerns raised over private construction works at Frankston Beach

image.altText: Cam Rayner holds the ball while he tries to shake off a tackle

props.synopsis: AFL boss Andrew Dillon says the league is prepared to move its season-opening clash between Brisbane and Geelong away from the Gabba if weather conditions continue to get worse.

title.children: 'Forecasts have changed': AFL says contingencies in place for Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens

props.synopsis: Months after the deaths of Holly Bowles and Bianca Jones, their families say they are furious at the lack of information from Lao authorities and want travellers to boycott the country until a proper investigation is held.

title.children: Parents of methanol poisoning victims describe investigation as 'disgraceful'

image.altText: Cosco Valencia at Port Phillip

props.synopsis: Cash-only stores, unmarked white vans, and a shipping container with falsified documents. Where does Australia's illegal cigarette trade begin?

title.children: More than a million illicit cigarettes are on this ship headed for Australia

image.altText: An outdoor shopping strip.

props.synopsis: The ABC spoke to a number of people living in St Albans, in Melbourne's west, on issues that they see as key ahead of the federal election.

title.children: In Melbourne's west, cost-of-living pressures could sway key contests

image.altText: Vincent Fantauzzo

props.synopsis: When artist Vincent Fantauzzo first appeared on Australian Story, he held back some uncomfortable truths. Now he's ready to unveil it all.

title.children: Artist Vincent Fantauzzo dropped a truth bomb at his father's funeral

image.altText: people in costumes crowd around a sign marked "drinking water".

props.synopsis: The Esoteric Festival, which brings thousands of music lovers to the tiny Victorian town of Donald, may not go ahead due to health and safety concerns.

title.children: Sold-out music festival at risk of last-minute cancellation

image.altText: John Furlan smiles at the camera wearing a grey hoodie with his arms crossed and placed on his leg in front of him.

props.synopsis: Police are offering the reward for information relating to the death of Gianni "John" Furlan, who was murdered in a car bombing in Melbourne's north 27 years ago.

title.children: Police offer $1m reward to solve 1998 carbombing murder in Melbourne

image.altText: Christian Petracca holds the ball

props.synopsis: Following from the devastating injuries he suffered in the King's Birthday last year, Christian Petracca was impressive for Melbourne ahead of the AFL season, while the Dockers shot down speculation Luke Jackson is angling for a return to Victoria.

title.children: Petracca overcomes nerves on return from injury

image.altText: A plume of orange smoke glows in the foreground behind a transmission tower immediately in front

props.synopsis: Authorities say the fire, which is being treated as suspicious, has burnt through 1,225 hectares of bushland, and smoke is visible from the Hume Freeway and Euroa.

title.children: Watch and act message as Strathbogie Ranges fire burns through bushland

image.altText: A render of the west gate tunnel entrance showing a ventilation structure.

props.synopsis: Locals in Melbourne's inner west have rallied in an attempt to convince the Victorian government to install pollution filters on ventilation stacks on the West Gate Tunnel project.

title.children: Residents in last-ditch plea for pollution filters on West Gate Tunnel project

image.altText: Kamagra, Cenforce-D and other male enhances within a cabinet

props.synopsis: Adult store chain Sexyland is selling multiple sexual performance drugs over the counter at several of its shops in Victoria, despite them not being approved by Australian authorities.

title.children: Sexyland selling unapproved sex performance drugs in Victorian stores

image.altText: A resources platform out at sea.

props.synopsis: A multinational petroleum giant has received approval to drill up to six exploratory gas wells in the Otway Basin, near biologically important areas for protected marine species.

title.children: Regulator approvals exploratory gas wells near Victorian marine parks

image.altText: Mitch Owens clutching his left shoulder after being injured in an AFL preseason match.

props.synopsis: St Kilda forward Mitch Owens looks to have escaped a serious shoulder injury, but Cooper Sharman will undergo surgery on a fractured thumb.

title.children: Saints forward Owens receives 'promising' scan news

image.altText: A GWS Giants player and a teen Colombian girl smile and high five each other.

props.synopsis: Young female athletes from a small Colombian town travel to Australia as part of a football exchange program that isn't just about playing the game.

title.children: Colombian teenage girls use Aussie Rules to help shape their future

image.altText: A man crouching down on a riverbank inspecting a bit of rock

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal elder says it is disgraceful an ancient cultural site on the Murray River was damaged during the summer holiday period.

title.children: Elder blasts 'disgraceful' damage to riverside midden site

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt looks at his seated son who is between his sister in black clothing and his brother in a Marvel top.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne family's distress during a recent travel experience has highlighted different airline approaches to disability seating on flights.

title.children: Family's flight ordeal puts airline disability rules in focus

image.altText: A portrait showing three different faces of actor Heath Ledger

props.synopsis: The acclaimed portrait of actor Heath Ledger has only been exhibited briefly in the past 17 years. That has artist Vincent Fantauzzo and the late actor's father asking questions.

title.children: 'You're going to win the Archibald Prize': Heath Ledger artist reveals portrait backflip

image.altText: Marcus Bontempelli in anguish after missing a kick

props.synopsis: Western Bulldogs star Marcus Bontempelli will miss the start of the AFL season after a calf issue, which was initially thought to be minor, proved to be more substantial.

title.children: Bontempelli to miss season start, Blues not worried about limping McGovern

image.altText: A close up photo of Tim Freedman singing near a mic at a keyboard

props.synopsis: What the gig guide at your local pub says about the health of Australia's touring music industry.

title.children: The Whitlams return to scene of 'worst-ever gig' as musos go regional

image.altText: A tracking bracelet on a man's ankle.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government is preparing to trial electronic monitoring devices on teenage criminals who are on bail in an attempt to re-engage them with school.

title.children: Victoria to trial ankle bracelets for high-risk high school offenders

image.altText: A chef bends over near a carton of eggs

props.synopsis: The ABC has analysed egg price data and the factors driving the cost increase, as bird flu continues to wreak havoc on supply.

title.children: Why Australian egg prices have hit a 15-year high

image.altText: Men working to construct a large transmission line tower, land dotted with shrubs, blue sky.

props.synopsis: Cost estimates for Australia's largest energy transmission project have blown out by almost 75 per cent, sparking fears of higher power bills.

title.children: Fears $1.5 billion transmission line cost blowout will increase bills

image.altText: Close-up photo of a large ship in port.

props.synopsis: The Scottish government denies it is planning to use a new Spirit of Tasmania ferry to house Ukrainian refugees. It comes after speculation it was in "advanced negotiations" to do so.

title.children: 'Not true': Scottish government denies refugee plan for Spirit of Tasmania ferry

image.altText: Image of a younger man with a hat and glasses in front of trees.

props.synopsis: The forced culling of millions of hens has led to egg shortages and rising prices across Australia.

title.children: No eggs on the shelves? One farmer lost 540,000 chooks overnight

image.altText: Shiraz grapes on the vine at the Kalleske winery in South Australia.

props.synopsis: Farmers in Australia's largest wine grape regions are calling on the federal government to implement a mandatory code of conduct immediately to stop a mass exodus of growers.

title.children: Wine grape growers demand safeguards for industry in 'crisis'

image.altText: Machinery in an open field with thick smoke in background

props.synopsis: The state has already endured two months of fires, but authorities warn there are likely to be more with tough conditions forecast for autumn.

title.children: Victorians told to expect more bushfires as autumn looks dry

image.altText: Police in a boat and a man standing in water.

props.synopsis: Water Police have retrieved a man from Albert Park Lake following an alleged stabbing at Middle Park on Saturday night.

title.children: Man arrested in Melbourne lake after stabbing incident

image.altText: A police car with slogans such as 'free labor thanks to Labour' written in chalk.

props.synopsis: A bitter police pay dispute in Victoria is set to come to an end, with officers and staff agreeing to a 20 per cent pay rise over four years.

title.children: Victorian police officers back pay deal, ending industrial dispute

image.altText: A woman in a yellow top and teens clutches her stomach on a couch

props.synopsis: A gynaecologist says he was 'perturbed' by the comments he heard right before going into surgery and diagnosing a woman with debilitating endometriosis.

title.children: Experts 'perturbed' by comments about endometriosis from Marty Sheargold

image.altText: An illustration of a measles particle.

props.synopsis: The Victorian health department says two cases of measles were detected at multiple locations in Melbourne and Bendigo over the past week.

title.children: Exposure sites in Melbourne and Bendigo listed for two measles cases

image.altText: Men at work

props.synopsis: Guitarist Ron Strykert says he was struggling mentally when he signed over his share of royalties from Men At Work songs to a US company in 2007.

title.children: Men At Work royalty dispute lands in Victoria's Supreme Court
